1.text: Remove the laces and insert shoe trees if you're brushing suede shoes.

2.text: Select a suede brush with soft bristles to get rid of light dirt.

3.text: Brush the suede material using gentle back and forth motions.

4.text: Give the suede a final swipe so the fibers are going the same direction.

5.text: Brush your suede using soft bristles weekly to give it a fresh look.

6.text: Absorb liquid stains right after they happen, if possible.

7.text: Dab white vinegar on dirt stains with a cloth to clean them.

8.text: Purchase a suede eraser to rub off tricky dirt spots.

9.text: Sand your suede using 1200-grit sandpaper to get rid of stubborn stains.

10.text: Cover the suede in a thin layer of clean water to fix water stains.

11.text: Sprinkle cornstarch or talcum powder over grease stains to fix them.

12.text: Treat suede with a spray so it repels dirt, water, and other stains.

13.text: Bring your suede to a leather cleaner if you can’t get the stain out.
